newsitem.title: USA: M.A. Hanna Co to buy rubber mixing unit.
newsitem.headline: M.A. Hanna Co to buy rubber mixing unit.

text.p: International specialty chemicals company M.A. Hanna Co said Monday it agreed to buy Chase Elastomer's U.S.-based custom rubber mixing operations and flexographic business unit for undisclosed terms.
The units had combined annual sales of $25 million in fiscal 1996, the privately-held Chase said.
The flexographic business unit manufactures photopolymers and distributed supplies to the printing industry, Chase said.

The acquisition is subject to regulatory approval, the copmany said. Chase Elastomer - U.K., Ltd., Chase's sister company based in Manchester, England, was not part of the acquisition, M.A. Hanna said.

"Chase is a very strong company that adds new technology and complements the markets served by M.A. Hanna Rubber Compounding," Douglas McGregor, president and chief operating officer, said. McGregor said M.A. Hanna would continue to pursue strategic acquisitions to achieve its target of doubling sales to $4 billion in the next five years.
